section.title: Navigating the Console

figure.title: CloudForms Management Engine's Main Navigation Menu

section.para: Click an item on the Primary Navigation Bar to go to that category. Then, you can click on a secondary item to refine the type of function.
The Console consists of the following items on the Primary Navigation Bar:

listitem.para: Cloud Intelligence uses Really Simple Syndication (RSS) feeds and charts to display information on your virtual enterprise devices. It also includes reports both out of the box and custom.
Services provides a view of all of your discovered Catalogs of services and Workloads (Virtual Machines and Cloud Instances combined).
Clouds enables you to see your Cloud Providers, Availability Zones, Cloud Tenants, Hardware Flavors, Security Groups, Cloud Instances, and Stacks.

Infrastructure enables you to see your Virtualization Providers, Clusters, Hosts, Virtual Machines, Resource Pools, Datastores, Repositories, and PXE Servers. You can also manage your infrastructure configuration through Configuration Management.
Control manages your policies through the Explorer, Simulation, Import/Export and the Log tabs. It further defines your policies by using Events, Conditions, and Actions.
Automate provides models for process integration and adaptive automation for events and activities.
Optimize enables you to identify bottlenecks and plan placement of Virtual Machines.

section.para: In addition to the items on the navigation bar, you can also use Configure to manage the user interface, create tags, set server, database and SmartProxy options, administer users, and update the software and view the documentation.
